definition: To approach, stop, and speak to somebody, especially in an aggressive or insistent way.
usage: The thief accosted the man and took all his money.

definition: To move forward toward a place or a goal
usage: After we advanced on the road all day long, we finally reached the end of our trip.

definition: To move forward
usage: People stood in line for tickets to the concert, slowly advancing to buy tickets at the ticket booth.

images.alt: Photo of soldiers advancing past a building
Photo of people walking forward

definition: Upsetting or disturbing
usage: I think loud, unexpected noises are alarming.

definition: Even though, while
usage: I had to take the math test, although I had not studied for it.

definition: Gathered together in one place
usage: All grades assembled in the auditorium for a school meeting.

images.alt: Drawing of people assembled in a theatre
Photo of people assembled in a street

definition: Finally and as a result of a series of events.
usage: The baby, at length, fell asleep after crying for over an hour.

definition: An action that is shocking in its degree of cruelty.
usage: Killing someone is an atrocity.

definition: Something that is true, not fake or misleading
usage: The gold bracelet was authentic, not fake costume jewelry.

definition: Blocked or closed off
usage: The shoppers tried to get into the store, but large crowds barred the doorway.

images.alt: Photo of man holding his had up to stop someone
Drawing of police officers blocking the road with cars

definition: an organized group of people
usage: A large body of people gathered to see the movie star.

images.alt: Photo of a large group of people in a street
Drawing of groups of colonial soldiers

definition: An organized group of soldiers
usage: There were about 50 soldiers in the body of troops I saw march in the parade.

images.alt: A body of troops walking through snow
Drawing of a body of troops walking

definition: People who are part of the same group, such as family or community.
usage: Sometimes I call my close friends my brethren, because we have a great deal in common.

images.alt: Photo of two brothers
Photo of a group of soldiers gathered together

definition: Gathered
usage: I collected all of my baseball cards together in one pile.

images.alt: Photo marbles collected together in a bowl
People gathered together in a stadium

pos: A representative is someone who speaks or votes for a group of people. A colonial representative speaks or votes for people who live in colonies, places that are ruled by another, more powerful country.
usage: The colonial representatives from New England spoke out against any new taxes that the English wanted to raise from the American colonies.

definition: Areas that are ruled by another country. American colonies were ruled by Great Britain.
usage: Louisiana was a French colony before it became part of the United States.

images.alt: Map of the American British colonies in 1760

definition: to start or begin to happen
usage: The school day commenced as soon as the opening bell rang.

definition: A grassy area of land that is set aside for public use. Commons, or greens, in colonial times were used as a space to meet and where all townspeople could graze their cattle.
usage: Today, the town common in Boston is a large, grassy park in front of the State Capitol building.

images.alt: Photo of church and buildings around a town common
Drawing of town common

definition: An organized group of soldiers
usage: The company of soldiers was sent off to war last month.

definition: To decide after considering all the facts
usage: I wrote an essay about television and concluded that, while it is fun to watch, I learn more by reading.

definition: Without any kind of plan or organization.
usage: People were left in confusion after the hurricane passed through New Orleans.

images.alt: Photo of a woman holding a tangled bunch of wires
Drawing of a group of people in confusion

definition: ‘This colony’ was Massachusetts. The Congress is the part of government that makes laws and that most directly represents the people.
usage: In Connecticut, the Congress of this colony would mean the part of Connecticut government that passes laws.

definition: A large amount
usage: The line was long and we waited a considerable amount of time before we got to go into the movie theatre.

definition: to ask others’ opinions before taking action
usage: I was not sure how to study for the test, so I decided to consult with my friends on how they planned to study.

definition: The group of delegates from each of the American colonies who met before, during, and after the American Revolution.
usage: The Continental Congress passed laws for the American colonies during the American Revolution.

images.alt: Painting of a meeting of the Continental Congress

definition: Opposite or against
usage: The car went the wrong way up the one-way street, contrary to what the signs directed the traffic to do.

definition: Testimony that is given by a witness under oath which can later be read in court when the witness is absent.
usage: My uncle was in the hospital, so he had to give his testimony through a deposition instead of coming to the courthouse himself.

definition: Separated from something else
usage: I detached all the tags from any new toys before I gave them to my baby brother.

definition: a small military unit separated from its normal, larger unit for a special mission.
usage: Just five soldiers, out of a group of fifty, were chosen to be a special detachment to cross enemy lines.

definition: To force another army to give up their weapons
usage: Police make sure to disarm anyone they arrest so that no one can get hurt.

images.alt: Painting showing defeated British troops giving up their weapons

definition: To shoot or fire off
usage: The gun accidentally discharged and hurt someone.

images.alt: Drawing of a man shooting two pistols
Drawing of soldiers discharging their rifles

definition: Found unexpectedly
usage: I heard a loud noise and when I looked out the window, I discovered that a raccoon was tipping over our trash can.

definition: sent somebody away to accomplish a task
usage: We were unsure of where we were, so I dispatched three groups to find what direction we needed to go.

definition: To move or scatter away in different directions
usage: I burnt the popcorn, so I opened the window to disperse the smoke.

definition: The amount of space that separates two things or places
usage: My house is a long distance from school, so I take the bus in the mornings.

images.alt: Photo of a grassy field with buildings in the distance

definition: General idea, main point or essential meaning
usage: She said that she wanted to go with me to the get lunch, or words to that effect.

definition: Under attack
usage: I feel embattled when I have too many papers due all at once.

definition: Move in a line, one behind the other
usage: The students walked, single file, through the hall to their next class.

images.alt: Drawing of people walking in a line, one behind another
Drawing of wagons and animals traveling in a line

definition: The right or left side of a line of soldiers, usually when they are in battle.
usage: I stood in the center, and on my sides were the right and left flanks of the army.

definition: a shallow part of a river or stream where people can cross to the other side
usage: The river was wide and deep everywhere but at the ford, where it was easy to cross through the shallow water.

images.alt: Photo of a shallow, narrow section of a stream
Drawing of a narrow, shallow section of a river

definition: Money and property
usage: The gambler lost his entire fortune when he lost the card game.

definition: In a very fast and violent way
usage: My sister yelled furiously at me when I broke her favorite necklace.

definition: a person, either appointed or elected, who is the leader of a state or colony
usage: The governor of my state is elected every four years.

images.alt: Drawing of Governor Wentworth, first governor of New Hampshire
Photo of a former governor of Minnesota

definition: A grassy area of land that is set aside for public use. Greens, or commons, in colonial times were used as a space to meet and where all townspeople could graze their cattle.
usage: Places that used to be as town greens are now used as public parks.

images.alt: Photo of church and buildings around a town common
Drawing of town common

definition: A small number
usage: My friend got many books at the library, but I only took out a handful.

images.alt: Photo of a small pile of coins
Photo of a small group of people

word: his person, family, crown, and dignity.
pos: An expression that means everything that is valuable to a person

definition: Fighting against someone
usage: Hostilities ended when each side agreed to stop fighting.

definition: Shouted, usually used to mean happiness or encouragement.
usage: A loud huzzah came from the miners when they saw that they had found gold.

definition: People who live in a particular place
usage: The inhabitants of my home are all members of my family.

images.alt: Photo of inhabitants of a colonial town

definition: Very cruel and vicious
usage: Mistreating a family pet seems like an inhuman thing to do.

definition: To ask a question about something
usage: I was unsure of how to get to my friend’s house, so I stopped in a shop to inquire if her street was nearby.

definition: Happening in the current month or year in which the author is writing
usage: I just had my birthday party, on the fifteenth of December instant.

definition: Something that happens right after something else
usage: When our teacher announced that the test was cancelled, we instantaneously began to cheer.

definition: Right away and without any waiting
usage: I touched the hot stove and instantly pulled my hand away.

definition: information about secret plans or activities
usage: We make sure that our intelligence is correct before we make any decisions.

definition: Having a plan to do something
usage: Jose was so angry, he left the restaurant intending to never return.

definition: Infantry is the soldiers who are trained to fight on foot rather than from vehicles. Light infantry soldiers are foot soldiers specially trained to fight independently rather than just as one large group. Each soldier is trained to be able to fight in a small, one-on-one skirmish with the enemy.
usage: The light infantry ran onto the battlefield as the cannon fired at the enemy soldiers.

images.alt: Drawing of soldiers crouching behind a wall
Photo of soldiers walking over a battlefield

definition: Interfere in an unwanted way
usage: Don’t meddle into other people’s business unless they ask you!

definition: A large building where people gathered in colonial times. A meetinghouse was the town church on Sundays. On other days, the meetinghouse was a place where people could meet.
usage: An old meetinghouse is built in the center of the of my town.

images.alt: Photo of the outside of a colonial meetinghouse
Photo of the inside of a colonial meetinghouse

definition: Things related to the army, navy, or other branch of the armed forces.
usage: People in the military wear uniforms when they are on duty.

images.alt: Photo of a military uniform
Drawing two navy ships in battle

definition: A group of people which is not part of the regular army but which can be called together to fight in an emergency.
usage: The militia practiced every day so that it would be ready if the regular army needed help.

images.alt: Drawing of American militia shooting at British soldiers

definition: connected to a government minister or department
usage: The heads of government in England give the English king or queen ministerial advice.

definition: A government department headed by a minister. A minister is a senior official in a government department
usage: The Ministry of Defense is one of the departments of the British government.

definition: The gathering together of a group of soldiers for inspection or to prepare for military action
usage: The group of volunteer fire fighters mustered at the firehouse to practice working with the new equipment.

images.alt: Photo of soldiers mustered together on a field

definition: Nearby or close to another
usage: Connecticut and Rhode Island are neighboring states because they are next to each other.

images.alt: Map of Massachusetts, Connecticut and Rhode Island

definition: A time when something happens
usage: I love parties and other happy occasions.

definition: to resist or be against something
usage: The other football team was ready to oppose us and tried to block the goal.

definition: individual facts, items, or details
usage: The newspaper told all the particulars of the bank robbery.

definition: Groups of people who are gathered to act together
usage: On Halloween, you see many small parties of children dressed in costume.

definition: happened
usage: I called my sister to tell her what events passed last weekend.

definition: People who support or defend their country
usage: The people we now think of as patriots, Americans that fought against the British during the Revolutionary War, were thought of as traitors in England.

images.alt: Drawing of an American colonist holding a rifle
Photo of boys carrying American flags

definition: Cruel or unfair treatment
usage: Ryan felt that he was a subject of persecution when he could not have any cookies or candy for dessert.

definition: small guns that are made to be held in one hand
usage: The pistol I saw at a museum had a curved wooden handle and a narrow metal barrel.

images.alt: Photo of pistols, gunpowder case and bullet maker

definition: Clear and with no doubt
usage: I am positive that I know how to get to the mall.

definition: To own or hold something
usage: I have some of my friend’s CDs in my possession, because she let me borrow them.

definition: event
usage: The court reporter wrote down all the proceedings that happened during the trial.

definition: To make a public statement which openly admits something.
usage: She professed her belief that all people are created equal to the large audience.

definition: An area controlled by another country
usage: Quebec is a province of Canada.

images.alt: Map of Newfoundland, a province of Canada

definition: Related to an area controlled by another country. The Massachusetts Provincial Congress was the part of Massachusetts government that could make laws for the Massachusetts area.
usage: The day to day laws of the colonies were passed by the provincial congress.

definition: The people who live in or come from an area ruled by another country
usage: The provincials wore farmers clothes, while the soldiers wore bright red uniforms.

definition: Actions, words, or something else that makes someone angry.
usage: Most dogs are nice, but some will bark and bite others with very little provocation.

definition: made them run away
usage: A dog ran toward the cats and put them to flight.

images.alt: Drawing of a zebra running away from a lion

definition: Someone who fights against a government
usage: In the Civil War, people in the North called people from the South ‘rebels’ because they were fighting against the Federal Government in Washington, D.C..

definition: Full-time professional soldiers
usage: The regular troops were well trained and were good at fighting on big battlefields.

images.alt: Photo of two professional soldiers

definition: An act that follows normal rules
usage: The rain fell in uneven bursts, without any pattern or regularity.

definition: Saying or doing something again
usage: The more repetitions I do on the fitness machines, the stronger I will become.

definition: Referring to something that was already named or mentioned.
usage: I wrote a letter and then went to mail said letter at the post office.

definition: Protect and make safe
usage: The store was locked and secured for the night.

definition: The time over which a meeting of a court or branch of government meets
usage: The singers practiced for three sessions before performing the music at the concert.

definition: Shots. The Americans fired their guns at the British soldiers.
usage: He crouched down low when he heard several shott fired close by.

images.alt: Drawing of old-fashioned boat with guns shooting from the side
Drawing of many soldiers shooting rifles

definition: The other 12 American colonies
usage: Virginia and Massachusetts were sister colonies before they became part of the new United States.

definition: the ruler of a country, especially a king or queen
usage: Queen Elizabeth II is the royal Sovereign of England.

images.alt: Painting of George III, English King during the American Revolution

definition: They stayed right where they were and did not move
usage: The guards stood their ground in front of the building, even though the crowd tired to push them out of the way.

images.alt: Painting of colonists waiting as British soldiers come near

definition: A willingness to surrender
Give into somebody else’s control or demands.
usage: I will not submit to any law that I think is unfair.

definition: Move so that all the space around something is taken and there is no way to escape.
usage: Adult elephants gather together and surround their babies to protect them from predators.

images.alt: Drawing of a field with a fence around it.
Drawing of a castle surrounded by water

definition: Riding a horse very fast
usage: The horse and swift-riding jockey won the horse race.

definition: When you promise that what you say or write is the truth.
usage: The witness was sworn in first and then told what she saw happen.

definition: Gently, or without any kind of fight or resistance
usage: The gentle breeze blew tamely through the trees.

definition: The name of an army group, in this case this refers to one of the British army groups.
usage: All the soldiers in the Tenth army regiment arrived safely home at the end of the war.

definition: They hid behind low stone walls that were in the fields

images.alt: Photo of a stone wall in a field

definition: Given secret information ahead of time
usage: My friend tipped me off that I can win the video game by getting a special key to open a room.

definition: Got hold of, captured
usage: I took three chess pieces from my opponent before he got even one of mine.

images.alt: Drawing of one soldier capturing another

definition: An event. In this case, the event is the battle of Lexington.
usage: I went to the bank and did several transactions, including cashing my check and depositing some money.

definition: To pass along a message or some information
usage: Colds and diseases spread when germs are transmitted from one person to another.

definition: A unit of soldiers
usage: The troops marched down the street in a tight group during the parade.

images.alt: Drawing of units of soldiers walking up a hill

definition: The harsh use of power over others
usage: When all power is in the hands of one person and no one has any right to complain, that is tyranny.

definition: Describing a state where people are ready to use weapons
usage: Because everyone was told to be under arms, I knew that they would all be carrying a gun or some other weapon.

definition: Up to our waists
usage: The water in shallow end of the pool came up to our middles, just about to our waists.

images.alt: Drawing of soldiers walking in water almost to their waists
Photo of children in water up to their waists

definition: A harsh punishment that is in response to another act.
usage: After the driver hit our family pet, I wanted vengeance.

definition: When many weapons, especially guns, are fired at the same time.
usage: When they heard the order to fire, the soldiers fired a volley of shots at the enemy.

images.alt: Drawing of cannon firing a volley of shots

definition: A cut or other injury that causes bleeding
usage: I wounded my elbow when I fell down on the sidewalk.

images.alt: Drawing of a girl with a cut on her head
Photo of a soldier on a stretcher
